column4: (I was the newbie trying to access my vista partition) I installed the NFTS Configuration Tool, but it isn't recognizing any more partitions, unless I don't know where to go to see that. Any ideas?
ntfs partitons in gusty and above should be detected automaticaly and mounted read only , didnT' it do that ?
No, they did not. They did when I was just using the Live CD, but now that I've installed, I can't find them
look in thye top panel in places , see them there ?
It shows 'Computer,' but if I go into that, it only shows up with my dvd drive and 'File System'
right click , mount ,  see if they show up on your desktop
What should I right click on?
the icon for your ntfs partion in my computer
There is no icon for NFTS partition in my computer
I thought you said you saw your windows vista hard drive in my computer ?
ok try this open a terminal , in applicaiton > accessories ,    type   sudo apt-get install gparted && sudo gparted,  this wil open the partiton manager,  see if your partitons are visible in there
It wants me to type in a password in my terminal after I've entered that command, but then it won't actually type anything when I press keys.
that,S normal , it's to hide the password from ppl looking over your shoulder
It says waiting for headers...so now I just wait?
patience,  the servers very loaded , might take a few minutes to dl and install , the command i gave you will open the app automaticaly when it is installed
no promisses yet,    M$ does not play well with others and Vista is their latest attempt at bullying other OSes from the computers,  might not work
